boardgame.name: Ship of the Line
boardgame.description:
As admiral of the fleet, you command your 3 captains in battle on the high seas. Though the wind may be against you at times, you can still use it to your advantage. Try to find the vulnerable spots to destroy or capture the enemy! Outmaneuver your opponent using naval tactics governed by the wind.

This game is based on the British and French battleships that fought each other during the Napoleanic Wars, and uses the sailing concepts, strategies and idioms of that period.

The 3D ships consist of a hull, 3 masts with 3 sails on each, 10 guns, and a wheel/rudder. As the ship takes hits, parts are removed from the ship. Each player has 3 ships and tries to cripple, capture or destroy his opponent.

listing.notes: Add $12.00 for shipping in the US. Contact ajcraft@comcast.net for shipping costs internationally.

boardgame.name: そして深海魚は０になる (Soshite Shinkaigyo ha 0 ninaru)
boardgame.description:
そして深海魚は０になる (Soshite Shinkaigyo ha 0 ninaru) is a card game from Japan, and means something like 'And The Deep Sea Fish Becomes Zero'. Players are trying to get their tableau of cards down to the lowest total. If a top and bottom row card match, those two equal zero. At the end of the game, the lowest total score wins.

The deck is numbered 1 to 8, with one 1, two 2s, three 3s and so on. Each number is a different sea creature.

Players have a tableau of six cards face-down in two rows of three. Two are turned up and the highest total starts. On their turn, a player draws either from the deck or from the discard pile. The player then uses the drawn card to replace an existing card in their tableau. The new card goes face-up, the old card goes face-up to the discard. If the player drew from the draw pile, they can discard it instead.

In this way, cards gradually get turned up. The game ends when either the draw deck is exhausted, or a player has all six cards face-up. The totals are calculated, and the lowest total wins.

However, the game has certain twists. For example, the 4 card is actually -4. The 5 card forces another player to turn up a card, possibly ending the sooner. Sharks must be placed as shown on the shark card, and so on.

Because there are more high number cards, it is harder to get the score down. But players have more chances to match pairs and make them go to zero.
user summary

boardgame.name: Foundations of Rome: Monuments Expansion
boardgame.description:
As the city of Rome continues to grow, so too do the ambitions of its architects. With population and commerce on the rise, the architects of Rome have set out to bring the Eternal City to new heights of glory. Romulus, our legendary king and founder, has spared no expense providing the materials to build epic Monuments to honor our gods, our citizens and our king. Soon Rome will be shining brighter than ever before!

The Foundation of Rome: Monuments Expansion adds a new, limited pool of shared Buildings that only the most talented architects can construct. Monuments are available for any player to build and are constructed just like Buildings from a player's personal supply. However, each Monument is unique and, once constructed, is no longer available for other players to build. Monuments are powerful, but many of these epic Buildings have special requirements that must be met before construction.

—description from publisher

listing.notes: New, includes monuments, 5th player, objectives, trading & stealing modules

boardgame.name: Run & Gun
boardgame.description:
A frenetic 90’s action movies inspired Print And Play board game, with App enhancement, for 2 to 6 players.
A first person shooter tabletop app powered print & play game.

A game of Run & Gun unfolds in a series of rounds. The app keeps track of the number of rounds and informs you when the final round arrives.

Each round involves two phases: the Run and the Gun phase. Run takes place in real time and is assisted by the app: during that phase you will try to take the action that interests you the most for the second phase (and I say try because another player could take it first!). The second phase plays out in rounds, starting with the player that has the carrot card. The players resolve one by one the actions they have selected in the previous phase.

Players get points when they complete the 3 types of goals. On the other hand, they can lose points depending on the amount of damage they received during the game.

At the end of the final round, the player who earned the most points, wins.

boardgame.name: Phantom Breaker Omnia
boardgame.description:
Phantom Breaker Omnia is a 2D fighting game continuing the story from Phantom Breaker, Phantom Breaker: Extra, and Phantom Breaker: Battle Grounds.

User Summary

boardgame.name: There are Other Worlds than These
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You are a World Walker. Whether through experimental technology, forbidden arcane ritual, god-curse, or sheer force of will, you are able to move between worlds. It is not easy - there are dangerous worlds out there, and you can get lost. But there are great wonders to see, limitless possibilities to explore.

OTHER WORLDS is a small system for building and travelling among worlds / dimensions / multiverses / planes. Create worlds on blank cards, share them, shuffle them, and explore. What will you find out there? Will you ever see home again? Do you even want to?
boardgame.rpg: There are Other Worlds than These

boardgame.name: Parlay
Parley
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

After years of war, you've been told to parlay with your enemy in a neutral village. This gives you the chance to learn more about your enemy you might not have had the opportunity to observe outside of battle. Will what you learn encourage you to push for peace, or will it lead to more violence?

Parlay is an SGS game that asks the question, "Is it better or worse to know thy enemy?" Roll a d20 and expand your knowledge about your enemy, the local village, and yourself.

boardgame.name: Punchcard Memories
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You used to be human, not so long ago. You are a transubstantiated mind, somehow slotted into a mechanical body and dumped in the blasted remnants of your memory palace. A junkyard full of touchstones, fading as your natural body dies. You only have a limited time to discover who you were, and perhaps, how you got here...

You awaken with only the dimmest understanding of who you were, but you know that you are in a junk archive of some kind, flush with memories. Your mechanical body can only explore so far, discovering and choosing memories before the archive is closed off. If you are stuck inside when the door closes, you will be doomed to wander endless possibilities, never knowing the truth and being unable to distinguish the realities. If you want to escape, have a semblance of a life, you must decide what to take with you before the end.

boardgame.name: Railroad Ink: Additional Cards Pack
boardgame.description:
The Additional Cards Pack bring a lot of new content to your Railroad Ink experience:

Expansion Goal Cards – A set of 15 new goal cards, containing three cards for Portal, River, Lake, Lava, and Meteor expansion.
Blueprint Cards – A set of 9 Blueprint cards that provides different starting conditions to further increase the challenge!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Railroad Ink Challenge: Lush Green Edition
Railroad Ink Challenge: Shining Yellow Edition

boardgame.name: Raising Hell
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You are a newly-certified Devil Breeder (congrats on passing the exam), and the time has come to hatch your Devil Egg and raise the Larval Devil inside into a champion!

In this solo TTRPG based on Monster Rancher, you'll help your Devil grow from a baby into an adult, training it all the while so it can be a proper Devil and win one of the numerous Tournaments available in the underworld!

You will Need:

- A deck of standard playing cards
- 3 six-sided dice
- A journal or sheet of paper
- A pen or pencil
- The spirit of Satanic Gentleness!

boardgame.name: Inner War
boardgame.description:
Multiplayer game system, inspired by some MTG mechanics, with heavy adaptation to a hex grid system like Advanced Squad Leader.

Each player controls a group of units, heroes and monsters trying to exploit every stat and ability in order to overcome the enemy group.

Depending on the game mode, you win by controlling certain parts of the map, or by destroying the enemy commander, or even by simply destroying every unit in the enemy group.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cartaventura: Caravanes
boardgame.description:
1331, Tangier. You have traveled a thousand times around your province in the wake of your merchant father. Your cousin Mohamed, explores the vast world; his letters make you dream of marvelous countries and legendary sultans. When his father falls ill, you decide to go in search of him.

The infinite East opens its arms to you, at last." Will you triumph over mountains and deserts? Will you escape from bandits and pirates? Will you become a rich merchant or a humble fakir? Will you be able to win over the Mongolian khans and the rajas of India? Will you find the trail of your elusive cousin, whom history will remember as the world's greatest traveler?

Cartaventura is a collection of narrative card games with an immersive storyline and multiple endings! Players build their adventure with the help of cards that offer different options. Cartaventura offers games set in different eras, each one faithfully reproduced. Players are immersed in history thanks to rich scenarios and watercolor illustrations, in homage to travel books.

A historical booklet, written with specialists, offers additional information. Cartaventura offers a tutorial that accompanies the first game. Its simple and original game system allows players to explore the scenario several times to discover all the secrets of the game. With what they have learned and with the help of different choices, they will be able to optimize their adventure to discover all the endings.

boardgame.name: Euromoney
boardgame.description:
For several years you have been experimenting with nanotechnological materials, in particular with graphene, you manage to discover an efficient way to produce it, you get the capital to start a business and you choose to focus on the European Union markets... but you are not the only one! The next few years will be key to position itself.

In a first phase, the participants will choose the countries in which they will initially invest and decide on their headquarters.

They will only be able to stay in a country, which manages to position itself better in the market, after checking the return on the initial investment (which is determined with a minigame of skill and fortune, the CT or coin toss).

Then the actions phase begins, where each player can perform one action per round, such as reinvesting in an already dominated market, conquering a free market, or attacking a market dominated by another player (all will be defined with the CT).

The final score is determined at the end of the fifth round, the participants will receive points according to the initial investment, the countries they dominate, according to the final value and their sizes, in addition to the bonus for maintaining the main venue or those that may have been obtained by a launch in the Kanchis sector (seven).


Desde hace varios años estás experimentando con materiales nanotecnológicos, en particular con el grafeno, lográs descubrir una forma eficiente de producirlo, consigues el capital para lanzarte a emprender y eliges concentrarte en los mercados de la Unión Europea... pero no eres el único! Los próximos años serán clave para posicionarse.

En una primera fase, los participantes elegirán los países en los que invertirán inicialmente y decidirán cuál es su sede central.

Sólo podrán quedarse en un país, quien logre posicionarse mejor en el mercado, luego de comprobar el rendimiento de la inversión inicial (que se determina con un minijuego de habilidad y fortuna, el LM o lanzamiento de monedas).

Luego comienza la fase de acciones, en donde cada jugador podrá realizar una acción por ronda, como reinvertir en un mercado ya dominado, conquistar a un mercado libre, o atacar a un mercado dominado por otro jugador (todas se definirán con el LM).

El puntaje final se determina al finalizar la quinta ronda, los participantes recibirán puntos según la inversión inicial, los países que dominen, de acuerdo al valor final y los tamaños del mismo, además del bonus por mantener la sede principal o de los que pudieran haber sido obtenidos por algún lanzamiento en el sector Kanchis (siete).

boardgame.name: Neverwinter - The Cloaked Ascendancy
Neverwinter: The Cloaked Ascendancy
boardgame.description:
the expansion added a new campaign, adventure zone, skirmish, and even more.

In The Cloaked Ascendancy, adventurers return to the city after the harrowing events of Storm King's Thunder to honor a fallen hero. However, a strange cabal of mages led by Gyrion the Ascendant have made themselves known and are prepared to wield their powers against the citizens of Neverwinter!.

boardgame.name: Hivemind
boardgame.description:
Hivemind is a reimplementation of The Mind, using Looney pyramids instead of cards. Hivemind is a real-time cooperative game where no communication is allowed (any sounds, gestures, et cetera). Each player has a random set of pyramids hidden behind a screen. Players try to play these pyramids in order without knowing which pyramids the other players have, and without communicating. There are no turns, so you have to 'guess' or 'feel' when to play your pyramids.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Veredicto
boardgame.description:
Veredicto is a fun board game, created in Argentina, where you have to defend cases and convince other players that what you say is true, in order to win!

It's time to give your “Verdict”!!! All participants must use their ingenuity, strategy and audacity to defend a statement, whether it is true or false, and persuade the other players with arguments to win, within the dramatization of a trial where the participants will play the roles of lawyers and jury.

Players must advance and add positions to win round after round each case as lawyers or by getting their verdicts right as a jury, until someone manages to win the game.

The game is innovative and contains a large dose of entertainment because the players learn from each case and have fun watching the lawyers argue in each case. In turn, the participants test their knowledge, in a unique dynamic where everyone plays all the time.

How to play?

The plot of the game is novel and captivating. Players take on the role of lawyers and - indicated by a card - must argue for the truth or falsity of a statement, trying to convince the other players (the "jury") to lean towards their defense.

It's a game for 3 to 6 players or teams where you'll be a lawyer and you'll have to defend unusual cases and convince the rest that your argument is true in order to beat your opponent. The objective of the game is to win as many cases as possible to move up in your career before the rest do. Each lawyer must defend a position regarding an affirmation, convincing the rest that what he says is correct.

boardgame.name: eMEMO Europe
boardgame.description:
EMemo is a memory game. Match the photos from locations around Europe and learn fascinating facts at the same time. Plus Bonus CD-ROM with extra content.

Challenging memory fun. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game, wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Carniverse
boardgame.description:
Imagine a world where you are no longer the top of the food chain. A world where society has fallen, governments cease to function, and countries fall into chaos. A new primeval world where the surviving members of humankind must band together in order to fight for their existence over scarce resources.
A new world filled with hungry, feral dinosaurs.
This is the world of The Carniverse. Will you lead your team of survivors to victory against their foes? Or will they become just another snack for the new gods of our planet?

This is a scenario-driven miniatures skirmish game played on a 3'x3' surface with terrain features. Each player controls a team of survivors battling against other teams of survivors for resources while trying to not get eaten by dinosaurs. Each team has specific skills and abilities. They are created based on available Resource Points.
Each game is divided up into five phases that make up a single game turn when combined.
The phases that make up a single turn are:

The Dino Phase
The Movement Phase
The Shooting Phase
The Melee Phase
The End Phase


When the last phase is finished, the cycle begins again until any victory or loss conditions for the scenario are met.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Carniverse: Tales of Survival Vol. 1

boardgame.name: Tallywood Rally
boardgame.description:
In Tallywood Rally, you will be in charge of your own halfling political campaign. Leverage the plans up your sleeve into clever plays: send assistants to rally and fundraise—increasing your popularity and treasury, pander to voters directly, build public works, and work with celebrities to get out the vote.

To take their turns, players will be using an innovative card mechanism which allows them to control the actions of their workers. Cards are played into one of four action columns, each with three possible spaces. Each unique space connects the icons on the cards in a different way, potentially revealing bonuses on the board itself. These action include:

Secure Funding: Construct a Public Works tile in this district to attract voters and increase your influence.
Celebrity Endorsement: Attract a celebrity endorsement to help get out the vote, increasing your polling in that district, and attracting new voters.
Research: Reveal the effects of a Celebrity of Public Work tile in a district, gaining support in the process.
Appeal: Spend your Popularity (credibility) to make a direct appeal to the voters of a District, increasing your polling and your vote share at game’s end.


After four weeks of campaigning the final vote is held! Voters are assigned to districts, players total up their vote shares in each district, and the player with the most votes wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wavestone Keep
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Fear the waves, the tides and the sea itself! A fearsome tower of stone roams the oceans, delivering its deadly cargo of lizardmen wherever it happens to land!

This is a small dungeon adventure, with an included map, introducing a floating, teleporting chunk of stone that wanders the seas collecting victims and treasures. It is designed for Old School Essentials. This adventure is desinged for parties of up to level three.

boardgame.name: A Bug On The Motherboard
boardgame.description:
You are a fly stuck in a computer!

Roll dice to move about the motherboard to collect Energy. Use that energy to power up the computer components (cpu, graphics card, etc.) and use capacitors to strategically assemble the components on your motherboard for extra points, but watch out! Resistors can pop and you can cause a short circuit and get Zapped!

Can you fully assemble your Motherboard before you get fried?! Or get some of your techy friends and compete to build you motherboard or varying boards and score the most points!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Questo
boardgame.description:
Your goal in Questo is to score as many words as possible, but the letters are presented in random order, so good luck fitting them all together.

Each player has a 6x6 game board and a set of letters. A set of red letters are placed in the center of play available to all. One player shuffles the deck of 36 cards, then reveals the top card. If the card shows a letter, everyone takes this letter from their set and places it somewhere on their grid, either face up as the letter or face down as a block (similar to a black space in a crossword puzzle). If the card shows "FREE" — a designation on the J, Q, X, and Z — then you can instead choose a red letter from the center area to add to your grid.

After all 36 cards have been revealed, score any words that you have created when you read your grid left to right and top to bottom, with each letter in each word being worth 1 point. Letters that are not part of a word are worth 0 points, and if every combination of letters on your grid forms a word, then you have created a "perfect square" and score 12 bonus points.

The rules suggest playing multiple games until someone passes 500 points. Questo can also be played as a solo game, with a player trying for the best score possible, with 52+ being quite difficult.

boardgame.name: The Wastelander's Guide to Tharkold
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

THE HORRIBLE FREEDOM OF THE OPEN ROAD!

The Wastelander's Guide to Tharkold offers a deeper look into the savage civilization that's taken hold in Northern Russia where reality has become twisted by pollution and fallout from Tharkold's destroyed maelstrom bridge. Humans and mutants roam the irradiated spaces seeking resources, and misery can be used as a fuel source. Strange enemies, both new and old hunt in the wastes between settlements.

Dare the ravaged countryside of the Blasted Land seeking pain, occultech, and a way to keep the engines revving!

INSIDE YOU'LL FIND:


Settlements and Cities that offer a semblance of trade and safety.
New equipment and psionic abilities.
Marauder Clans and new monsters that rule the wastes.

boardgame.name: A Trifling Matter Soundtrack
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

This official release from composer Ralf Kurtsiefer and his "Orkpack" studio mates contains seventeen tracks of (mostly) instrumental music meant to provide atmosphere and accompaniment to the Torg Eternity adventure, "A Trifling Matter."

boardgame.name: Nidavellir: Thingvellir – Crovax and Odroerir Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
Rules:
- Crovax the Döppelgänger
Crovax is a neutral Hero that adds 25 points to your Final Bravery Value.
Put him in your Command Zone and discard immediately the last dwarf card from the column of your choosing.
It is the same power as Bonfur, so all rules that apply for Bonfur are to be applied for Corvax.

- Odroerir, the Mythic Cauldron
During set-up, put Odroerir aside.
Shuffle the Age 2 Camp cards, then put Odroerir on the top of the deck. Therefore, at the beginning of Age 2, Odroerir will be amongst the 5 available Camps cards. As soon as an Elvaland takes a card from the camp, put the smallest coin available from the Royal Treasure on Odroerir.
Do this until an Elvaland takes the Odroerir card with the coins on it.
The Odroerir card with its coins goes in the Command Zone.
At the end of the game, Odroerir adds the sum of all the coins on it to your Final Bravery Value.

listing.notes:
[b]All prices are inclusive of UK and EU VAT, but do not include shipping costs.[/b]
[size=14][b]Flat Rate Shipping:[/b][/size]
The shipping cost is the same regardless of the number of items ordered: 2 Euros within Germany. 3 Euros to Albania, Australia, Belarus, Brazil, Canada, China, Faroe Islands, Greenland, Iceland, Indonesia, Israel, Japan, Liechtenstein, Malaysia, New Zealand, Norway, Russia, Singapore, South Korea, Switzerland, Taiwan, Thailand, Turkey, and the USA. 4 Euros to Austria, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Czech Republic, Cyprus, Estonia, Finland, France, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxemburg, Macedonia, Malta, Mexico, Moldavia, Monaco, Montenegro, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Ukraine, United Kingdom, and Vietnam. 5 Euros to Bulgaria, Croatia, Denmark, Hungary, Romania, and Sweden. 6 Euros to all other countries.
NOTE: The shipping rates for deliveries outside of the EU and UK have been discounted to make up for the fact that no VAT is paid for sales outside of the EU and UK. However, there may be import taxes for deliveries outside of the EU and UK, and the buyer is responsible paying these.
[size=14][b]Payment Options:[/b][/size]
[size=12][b]Paypal:[/b][/size] No fee is charged to you, if you pay using Paypal. But Paypal does not change currency at the fair market rate. So you will lose 3% or more of your money, if you are converting to Euros.
[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.
[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money.
[size=12][b]Interac e-transfer:[/b][/size] If you have a Canadian bank account (like me), then you can pay by Interac e-transfer. In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.
[size=14][b]I take responsibility for the safe delivery of your order:[/b][/size] I am a registered commercial seller. Thus, insofar as you are a private consumer, it is required by German law that I take responsibility for any loss or damage of goods that occurs during shipment.
[size=12][b]Looking for something that is not listed here?[/b][/size]
I also sell larger items on BGG here: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/the_canadian_gamer?pageid=1
If you want to combine items from my other alias, let me know. The flat rate shipping offered here does not apply to the items listed there. The items sold here will typically (but not always) ship for free with the items sold there.
I can also make [size=12][b]special orders[/b][/size] for items that I don't have in stock. Send me a message concerning an item, and I will check for availability and tell you what the price would be.

NEW - unpunched
Check out my other items and bundle and save on shipping.

boardgame.name: Ascent: Give rise to an Empire
boardgame.description:
It is time to conquer a new frontier. As global overseer you have ambitious plans for your expansion into the galaxy, but space is large and there are many contenders to deal with. From the peaceful Alliance to the insect-like Swarm or the warrior race Kthuani. Do you have what it takes to emerge victorious from the galactic power struggle?

Ascent is a solitaire, 4x, sci-fi, roll and write game in which you must explore your local sector, discover and lay claim to new systems and their resources, defeat your enemies in battle and trade with your allies (or destroy them too).

The game is played over a series of turns divided into 6 phases. During each turn you’ll gather resources, explore space and colonize star systems, construct new structures to progress your colonies, improve your armada and advance your political agenda.

Win the game by efficiently managing your commodities and time in order to pursue one of the 3 different, species-specific, winning conditions (Goals).

Once you complete any one of your goals the game ends and, optionally, you can determine your final score.

Will you be remembered as an all-powerful leader? A grand merchant? A warmonger? A political genius? Or something entirely different?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mini Meeple Melee
boardgame.description:
"Big Battles, Tiny Tin!"

Mini Meeple Melee is a combat arena game you can carry anywhere! 2-4 players select from 6 unique classes and battle in 1 of 3 different modes to the death. You can fight in free-for-all fights, team matches, or boss battles. For such a small package, the battlefield is surprisingly modular. Select your terrain, place the crates and magic circles, and position the tins. Then you're ready to drop in and start brawling!

Each turn you can perform 2 actions. Basic actions include moving, resting, or taking cover. You can also use 1 of your characters unique skills, usually to attack your opponents.

This game is quick, fun, & simple. So it's great for anyone, anytime, anywhere!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wavelength - A Party Game
Wavelenth
boardgame.description:
Wavelength is a party game in your pocket. Hot or cold. Soft or hard. Wizard or…not a wizard? Work together to decide where your clue falls on the spectrum – and win by reading your friends’ minds.

The Wavelength app is an evolution of the hit boardgame that allows you to play remotely or in person on iOS and Android devices. And it features loads of new content and designs, like real-time synchronous dial movements and live emotes.

- Publisher Blurb

boardgame.name: 30 Days of Mork Bork Adventure Chapbook Vol. 2: On the Island of Dying Gods
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This book expands the one-page, one-shots[...]and is the second volume in a planned series of ten. For this volume, we focused on creating three distinct modules within a larger keyed setting, but there’s still plenty of room for improvisation and substitution at your table.

boardgame.name: Grimoire Umbra
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Uncover ancient secrets of the multiverse through a renowned mage's lost notes in this supplement.

boardgame.name: Champions of Midgard: Polyhedral Dice Promo Tiles
boardgame.description:
Military and economic promo tiles that were sold with a limited-edition custom made complete polyhedral dice set.

The two promo tiles are:

Varangian Guard: Roll the die on this tile and collect Viking dice based on the result. Every round this tile is not selected, replace the die with the next larger polyhedral die. (The Varangian Guard was a Viking military unit that served as personal bodyguards to the Byzantine Emperors.)

Taflkast House: Roll the die on this tile and collect Glory equal to the result. Every round this tile is not selected, replace the die with the next larger polyhedral die. (Taflkast is a Viking dice game.)

boardgame.name: Yummy Yummy Pancake: Promo Tokens
boardgame.description:
Three all new varieties of pancake tokens to add to your Yummy Yummy Pancake game! Play with the normal rules, OR enjoy some NEW rules variations to make the game a little more difficult or to mix it up a little!

The new pancake flavors are:

Caramel Apple Pecan
Ice Cream & Chocolate Sauce
Wild Berry
The tokens come with ONE new set of rules.

boardgame.name: The Deadliest Game
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rumors tell of a jungle shrine in the domain of Valachan, and Alanik has asked you to brave the dangers within in search of the vestige that sleeps within an amber sarcophagus. While the jungle is the clearest danger, you'll have far deadlier things to contend with than beasts and plants.

The tenth adventure in the Ravenloft: Mist Hunters series of adventures.

An adventure for 6th level characters.

CONTENT WARNING: horror, gore, oppression (xenophobia, genocide, humanoid hunting, ritualistic murder, forced survival combat), death, abuse (forced amputation), environmental hazards (jungle), possible phobia triggers (insects, snakes, leeches).

boardgame.name: Lifeblood Desert Fortress
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This desert fortress holds an ancient artifact, shaped like a giant skull, which bleeds crimson from its eyes into a fountain. The fort itself is spiked and highly defensible from its high position in the cliff.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring a mayor seeking to hide his dark doings–which has condemned heroes to a terrible death, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Tinderbeard's Pirate Stronghold
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This seaside fortress holds an ancient trove of treasure. Wooden piers lead from docked vessels deep into the spiked stronghold, which is filled with living areas and prison cells both.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring a retired pirate saving his granddaughter (and a magical map of teleportation), you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Dark Elf Underdark Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A spiked and heavily fortified underdark fortress filled with signs of giant spiders. It’s complete with prison cells, living areas, and an experiment room splattered with blood and chains.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring mutated giant spiders, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Sea Warden's Ruined Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An underwater temple, filled with cells and different locked rooms. Tiled floors look beautiful beneath dappled sunlight, while outside fish dart and corals cling to the rocks.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring sea-life grown to enormous sizes due to a giantism potion, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: New Eden's Underwater Biosphere
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Want to submerge your players into an underwater paradise?

This map is of an experiment beneath the waves. Sunlight flickers down onto a glasshouse series of domes, built above the sand on the sea floor. An entrance chamber is designed to pressurise and release water upon entry, while further in, trees which bear perpetual fruit and pure, ever-replenishing water waits in serenity. Outside, corals drift in the waves, while schools of fish dart around.

With this map and its detailed, Bioshock-inspired adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Destroyed Spacecraft Biodome Gardens
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for the drifting wreck of a spaceship?

Then this map is perfect for you! It’s of a shattered biodome, mounted to the hull of a drifting space wreck. There are so many possibilities for this battlemap—you could have your players encounter aliens whilst trying to salvage, or perhaps a rogue ship’s artificial intelligence that sends little droids after your party.

With this map and its detailed, Aliens-inspired adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Spacecraft Biodome Gardens
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a spaceship with a biodome garden, Silent Running style?

Then this map is perfect for your specific needs! :P It features a lush biodome mounted to the metal hull of a space ship. Is it filled with the last, endangered greenery from a planet, sent in a search to find a new home? Or a terraforming delivery? Perhaps, is it farming drugs that need an ultra-specific environment in which to grow, and fetch a hefty price on the black market? There are so many possibilities for this battlemap—and it could be yours today!

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Wasteland Biodome
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a lush, desert haven?

This map takes a new and unique twist to the desert oasis stereotype. The glass biodome houses a wonderfully lush selection of bushes and trees, as well as fresh water bubbling up from a spring. Perhaps it was built by mages, or a group of academics seeking to create their own paradise with the desert to protect them.

Regardless of why it is here, the dome connects to a vast underground tunnel system that runs like highways beneath the desert. It might be ancient, far, far older than it looks. Or perhaps it has only just been built for some great plan…

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving druids, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Moonlight Isle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a beautiful, moonlit island battlemap?

This magical isle is overgrown with strange, otherworldly greenery. The waves glow blue around it, fading into darkness as it stretches out into midnight ocean. There are strange patterns in the sand, and the greenery has a blue tinge. Is it something only seen in dreams, or other realms?

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving a devil, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Snake Isle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for an island battlemap involving snakes?

The island has a huge snake statue, as well as lush tropical greenery, and snake trails in the sands. While you *could* theoretically fill this island with Eastern Hognose snakes faking their own deaths and playing dead, what would that make the combat? So we decided to fill the island with every snake imaginable in our adventure prompt that comes with it.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving a snake monster-girl, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: The Ancient Isle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a small island battlemap?

The map is ready for payers to wash up on and make a raft out of turtles to escape (using only the hair from their back, of course). It’s covered with palms trees and small tropical shrubs, but that’s about it.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Feywild Crystal Manor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a manor in the fairy realms?

In this map, everything is a little off. The lush forests outside are vibrant and flicker slightly with rainbow hues, as do the crystals and babbling brooks (don’t listen to their lies). The crystal manor itself is in a highly defensible position, though it’s designed for leisure. It is filled with sumptuous living quarters and strange artefacts.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving a fairy princess, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Snuff the Ember, Kill the Flame
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure is written using the Arcanis Roleplaying Game ruleset

Legends of Arcanis Season 3 The War of the Paragons

Hard Point 10 Snuff the Ember, Kill the Flame

This adventure is the tenth installment in the War of the Paragons story arc!

The mystery of the red-headed woman retrieved from the Well of Souls is revealed, and a millennia-old secret begins to unravel.

A Standard adventure optimized for five Tier III Heroes.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires

boardgame.name: Snuff the Ember, Kill the Flame
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure is written using the Arcanis Roleplaying Game ruleset

Legends of Arcanis Season 3 The War of the Paragons

Hard Point 10 Snuff the Ember, Kill the Flame

This adventure is the tenth installment in the War of the Paragons story arc!

The mystery of the red-headed woman retrieved from the Well of Souls is revealed, and a millennia-old secret begins to unravel.

A Standard adventure optimized for five Tier III Heroes.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires

boardgame.name: Generic Adventure Magazine (Issue 3 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
Spice up your campaign!

Get down to the gritty story-telling by brining in time-travel, mechanics, aliens and stuff that almost does not belong - but is fun anyway. Also notes about music, noise, props and character-switching!

boardgame.name: A Cultist Headquarter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your investigators will probably want to infiltrate this lair, which is run by the grand master of ceremonies. Good luck to them!

It's swarming with worshippers, the smell is pestilential because of the corpses of prisoners abandoned in the jails or in the torture room (probably former investigators...). The library is full of ancient books with abominable engravings, the lab with sordid artifacts. But the worst is this big room at the end, protected by a kind of dark magic. They all enter during the moonless nights, and terrifying screams escape from it...

boardgame.name: A Park in the City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your investigators will certainly want to go to this park, where a crime took place...

Some people are walking around and you will be able to glean some information. What did the pigeon lady see?
And what is the secret of this statue of a former monarch of the city?

While you are meticulously scanning for the slightest clue, you don't notice that a gap is created towards the lake, revealing a deep abyss...

boardgame.name: The Parade of Ghouls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your investigators descend these cold and slippery stairs. And the crypt seems to lead to something else. Something twisted, from where wild screams seem to come... You will have to plunge into the depths, walk among the countless bones, to witness what is hidden in the darkness!

boardgame.name: Innsmouth Harbor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your investigators will certainly want to question all the fishermen who work in the port. Once again, they look at you with a distrustful look... Oh by the way, their eyes are strange and bulging... This investigation will take time, you will have to stay in the area! Once the night falls, a thick fog invades the place...

boardgame.name: The Lost Ziggurat
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your investigators have gone deep into the jungle...

They walk exhausted by the heat, the humidity and the mosquitoes.

But in the distance stands a stone monster, forgotten by our contemporaries. Reaching its summit reveals sacrificial practices from another time. But going down inside will be much worse...

boardgame.name: A Dark Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your investigators sink inexorably into the darkness. Their steps treading on a wet and tricky ground. It is not the dead animals here and there, which will make them lie. This place is not healthy.

It is getting quieter and quieter… The forest is silent, and that not to wake up the thing lurking in the depths....

boardgame.name: The Residence of Mr Finkle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your investigators will certainly want to visit this beautiful and richly decorated property. Here luxury is everywhere, but also discretion. If they want to ask for information, they will probably have to wear a mask to hide their identity and enter the many small rooms and salons. Perhaps you will meet the host of these places... Who knows?

It is said that he sometimes shows up at big parties that he gives in honor of some ancient god...

boardgame.name: The Miskatonic Library
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Here we are! The most famous library in the United States of America is located at the prestigious Miskatonic University in Arkham. You'll have to wait for opening hours, sit quietly at a table and browse through one of the countless old books that are kept here.

It is said that there are some absolutely rare ancient books...maybe even dangerous :

"What do they call it again? : Micronomicon... Nicromonicon... Crimonomic... Oh Wait...!"

With a little luck and insistence, the person in charge, Dr. Armitage, will be able to give you a tour of the building and show you its treasures...

boardgame.name: The Blue Mermaid Ocean Liner
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

How nice it is to take a little rest on board a middle-class liner!

These few days of crossing will allow your investigators to reach Europe, Africa, Asia or Australia, in good conditions. They will be able to enjoy the view, walk, listen to jazz or read their favorite old book. If the weather doesn't get worse... it's like a real vacation!

boardgame.name: The Peacock Cargo Ship
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Today, your investigators have the opportunity to organize or participate in the biggest expeditions to discover the unknown! The cargo ship is designed to navigate the most dangerous waters of the globe. It carries a large cargo, a research room, an infirmary and enough space for a scientific team.

It's not uncommon for stowaways to hide among the hundreds of crates containing the latest technology of the time, traveling unbeknownst to the crew... unless they are your own investigators.

boardgame.name: Happy New Year 2022
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

2021 saw the birth of Lovemaps.

I was able to accomplish a lot thanks to your support, your encouragement and your little words.

To celebrate, the Antarctic picture can be used as a map.

boardgame.name: Starter Pack City 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

If you play Call of Cthulhu, you will probably need a place to house your investigators, a library or a press office to get information, a restaurant to make appointments, and of course, a hospital to get treated.

boardgame.name: Standoff Roleplaying System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Standoff Roleplaying System is a new roleplaying game meant to cover many different genres and styles of play. Specifically created with it's own emulator, the system is great for solo play. A fun and kinetic dice pool system resolves actions in moments, and as a result combat and scenes of high tension feel create an interesting gravity that replaces tedium and rules lawyering that can be inherent to some systems.

boardgame.name: Trials of the Sensei
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Learn the greatest secrets of swordsmanship when you undergo The Trials of the Sensei! The fifth expansion for the popular Katanas and Kimonos line is both an adventure and a toolkit for creating your own stories. It adapts the classic archetype of the wise mentor who imparts gifts of knowledge.

More than simply showing students how to swing a sword, this supplement demonstrates how the principles of swordsmanship and those of poetry, dance and other artistic disciplines are one and the same.

Using the tools in this supplement you can craft a sensei NPC with a full history, as well as an unorthodox teaching style that adds to the immersion of your games.

boardgame.name: Mass Battles
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Take to the field of battle. In this document you can find rules to make large-scale battles easy to narrate, whether you're hosting a clash of 10s of soldiers on each side, or tens of thousands of them.

There are also prompts for how to best utilize every character in a party during a battle, even if they're not a soldier. Lastly, you get a playmat for making it effortless to track each die roll.

boardgame.name: Folk Heroes, PC Races, and Hidden Power
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Take to the field of battle. In this document you can find rules to make large-scale battles easy to narrate, whether you're hosting a clash of 10s of soldiers on each side, or tens of thousands of them.

There are also prompts for how to best utilize every character in a party during a battle, even if they're not a soldier. Lastly, you get a playmat for making it effortless to track each die roll.

boardgame.name: The Agadatsu Clan
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this empire, only the strongest and most cunning come out on top. The boldest of all warlords are those who ruthlessly seize every opportunity. Cross paths with the most ambitious of all the samurai lords in the Agadatsu Clan supplement for Katanas and Kimonos.

boardgame.name: The Ketsuga Clan
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore the Midnight Valley and meet its mysterious denizens in this supplement for Katanas and Kimonos. The Ketsuga, also known as the Luna Moth Clan, inhabit an area where hills and fog lead to an almost-perpetual night. Their samurai are renowned for both their grace and their beauty.

boardgame.name: Gadget Grid
boardgame.description:
Two ten-sided dice determine both the initial placements of player tokens and the placements of Gadget Cards throughout the game. Setup takes less than a minute and gameplay is simple and fast-paced. 2-8 players scramble around a 10x10 board collecting Gadget Cards that can alter the layout of the board, enhance their own abilities, change existing conditions, or - most importantly - attack other players. Attacks remove one of three "Life Gizmos" from a player. Players battle until only one person has any Life Gizmos left.

During a turn, players will move around the board collecting Gadget Crates. They can play Actions, spawn new Gadget cards, or move any player token that does not have Life Gizmos. At the end of their turn, they can Attack other players, removing one Life Gizmo from every target they hit.

When a player is reduced to 0 Life Gizmos, they can no longer collect or use Gadget Cards, but can still move around the board and damage other players. If they manage to get to a player who still has Life Gizmos, they steal one of them and can continue gathering and playing Gadget Cards as normal. Gameplay continues until Life Gizmos have been removed from all but one player.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Calabozo: Una nueva aventura
boardgame.description:
The four legendary dragons have been stripped of their sacred gems and require the help of intrepid adventurers who are experts in combat, each dragon will qualify the most suitable to fulfil the mission and as help, they will receive a legendary weapon, not counting the magical elements that can obtain during your adventure.

You must rescue six sacred gems and return them to the dragon that recruited them before the other adventurers

You move around the grid rolling the normal dice, you must defeat the wolves along the way, and keep moving until you find an enemy creature, the combat is done with custom attack dice and a damage track.
If you defeat the creature, you get one of the sacred gems.

boardgame.name: HD1 - HabiteD Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to HabiteD, the world of DarK SkY is no longer your only place to find adventure as a mysterous gateway brings our Actors to a new world where a race known as the Thamians beg of you to help them fight off the invading Alien races of the Bah and their minions.

Beginning in this strange new world they will have to win back the cities and end the cultivation of Thame by the Bah and protect the passive Thamians and thier world from attack. To do this, Actors will find themselves going from 1885 technology to straight Science fiction star ships, jump jets, pulse rifles and combat with Alien beings, plants, and animals. Thame was once peaceful but now, it is as hostile a planet as one might find, full of adventure and exploration.

This Core Rule Book also features new playable Races, Alien Monsters, new Alien Races, new Skills to the DarK SkY mechanics, as well as a completely wide open universe waiting for them to make their mark in.

Just like with DarK SkY, Actors can elect to have Magical abilities, Mental abilities, great combat abilities, skills to create fantastic inventions and learn how to operate and use advanced weapons and vehicles.

This system is the same exact system as the DarK SkY product which uses D6 dice pools against either environmental challenges (Difficulty checks) or directly against an opposing Extra (or adversary) die pool rolls to determine success and the levels of success. It is a simply system to avoid complicating players and the Director with difficult math and time consuming calculations. We remove the difficulty to allow you to focus on Role- Playing verses Roll-Playing.

boardgame.name: Apotheosis
boardgame.description:
The King is a formidable ruler, whose strength and cunning have not been matched in a generation. But he is away on a diplomatic visit to another realm... now is your chance to seize the throne!

Take control of his legion troops and he will be ill equipped to stand against you.

Master the dark arts and summon a demon and he dare not oppose you.

Infiltrate his court and turn his own advisors against him and he will be powerless to stand in your way.

But, if he returns before you accomplish one of those things, kiss your ambitions good-bye.

Will you have the best reputation among the guilds when the king returns?

Apotheosis is a worker placement game where each of your workers have a type and a level. Many of the worker spaces care about one, the other, or both of those attributes. Blocking is a big dynamic in worker placement games, and in this one you are allowed to use a space as long as your worker is at least tied for the highest level there when you place it. This means there's not as much blocking at the beginning of the game, but as players level their workers up, blocking (and therefor placement tension) becomes more and more of a thing.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Keeping Up With The Joneses
boardgame.description:
One-up your neighbors in 6 different aspects of life, while trying to keep up with the Joneses up the street, who really seem to have everything together!

In this rondel game, each space on the rondel has a track representing a life aspect you can compete in: Job, Home, Kids, Cars, Charity, and Social. When you land on a space, you advance that track. Occasionally, an aspect will score in a majority fashion (farthest up the track gets 1st reward, etc), but if you are too far behind the Jones marker, then you don't gain any status!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Game of Trumps
boardgame.description:
Game of Trumps is a trick-taking card game for four players. It is played in partnerships, but what sets this game apart is that players do not know who their partners are at the beginning of the round! The partnerships are revealed over the course of the round through cardplay.

The deck consists of four suits: Circles, Squares, Triangles, and Trumps. The Trump suit has cards numbered 1 to 14, while the other three suits are numbers 1 to 6.

There is no bidding, and play proceeds like most trick-taking games, with one player leading a suit and other players following if they can. Certain cards are worth points if they are taken as part of a trick.

The player or players that have the top two trump cards are on one team, and the rest of the players are on the other. This is not revealed before the round, but through normal card play.

At the end of the round, each player scores points based on how their team did during the round. The first player to 10 points wins!

boardgame.name: Forza Horizon 3: Blizzard Mountain
boardgame.description:
Source: [Xbox.com The Publisher Website].

The Blizzard Mountain expansion for Forza Horizon 3 brings snow, ice, extreme elevations, and blizzards to challenge players in their quest to become King of the Mountain. Explore this extreme alpine playground in eight new cars and trucks including the 2016 Ford GYMKHANA 9 Focus RS RX. Compete in thrilling new mountain race events like Hill Climb, Descent, and Blizzard Races. Discover new Bucket List Blueprints, Rivals events, Xbox Live Achievements, a new barn find car, and more. This add-on is available separately, or as part of the Forza Horizon 3 Expansion Pass.

boardgame.name: Neverwinter - Curse of Icewind Dale
Neverwinter: Curse of Icewind Dale
boardgame.description:
the expansion added a new campaign, several new adventure zones, a new epic skirmish along with numerous other updates.

Log in and experience the new Heroic Encounters and open-world PvP combat while working as a mercenary for one of two opposing mercenary groups, the Ten-Towners or the Arcane Brotherhood.

boardgame.name: Neverwinter - Storm King's Thunder
Neverwinter: Storm King's Thunder
boardgame.description:
the expansion added a new campaign, several new adventure zones, a new dungeon and numerous other updates. The campaign module had its own expansion, Sea of Moving Ice, which concluded the storyline introduced in the Storm King's Thunder campaign.

Adventurers will travel north to Bryn Shander - capital of Icewind Dale - to investigate the sudden presence of frost giants in the region. No visit to Icewind Dale would be complete without the help of Catti-brie and Wulfgar - characters from R.A. Salvatore's novels - who will aid adventurers in their quest to stop the invading giants.

boardgame.name: Forza Horizon 3: Hot Wheels
boardgame.description: To play the Forza Horizon 3 Hot Wheels expansion, some progress is required in the full game. You must complete enough Exhibition Events and PR Stunts to build your second festival site, after which the expansion will become unlocked and accessible on the game map. The Forza Horizon 3 Hot Wheels expansion is the ultimate playground for cars! Located off the coast of Australia, this chain of islands is here to make your Hot Wheels fantasies come to life with loops, corkscrews, boost pads, high bank turns, half-pipes, insane jumps - and even mechanical dinosaurs! Race ten new cars including Hot Wheels icons like the Twin Mill and Boneshaker. Create custom Hot Wheels events by swapping out stunt track sections and dare your friends to try them. Also included is a new hidden barn find car to discover, new Xbox Live Achievements, new Bucket Lists, Rivals, new multiplayer arenas and more. Available for purchase separately, or as part of the Forza Horizon 3 Expansion Pass.

boardgame.name: エジプトウォール (Egypt Wall)
boardgame.description:
エジプトウォール (Egypt Wall) is a game from Japan. Players are constructing Egyptian wall murals. Players can choose cards to add to their panel, or to improve the way their panel scores. Balancing the choices is a challenge.

The game has a set of score cards laid out in a column, and panel cards depicting various Egyptian characters laid alongside each score card. As players take panel cards, they place their own cubes on the scoring section of the score card.

When a player takes a new panel card, it is placed at either end of their display, or between existing cards. But players cannot shuffle the cards around as they like.

The panels depict various figures, some holding decorated items, some showing their eyes, some facing to the left or right. As the panel builds up, players want to optimise their scoring with the right panels in the right place.

Some scoring cards have limits that must be exceeded or restricted, such as more than 3 of one image, or fewer than 7. Some cards have very particular scoring, such as create a line of mummy, eye, eye, woman. The mix of figures on the panels and the mix of scoring needs creates a difficult choice for players.

The game is played over two rounds, and the player with the highest score at the end is the winner.

The second edition had some tweaks to the rules and the card contents to improve gameplay.
user summary

boardgame.name: Furtivo
boardgame.description:
Strategy game for two players.

The object of Sneaky is to be the first player to capture all five of your opponent's checkers.

The game has two dice, one of movement (from 1 to 3) and another Furtive dice, empty on five sides and with an eye on the sixth. The player will roll the dice secretly and will be able to lie about the result, being able to play a "bluff".

-------------------------------------------------------------------Juego de estrategia para dos jugadores.
El objetivo de Furtivo es ser el primer jugador en capturar las cinco fichas del oponente.
El juego dispone de dos dados, uno de movimiento (de 1 a 3) y otro dado Furtivo, vacío en cinco caras y con un ojo en la sexta.
El jugador tirará los dados de forma secreta y podrá mentir sobre el resultado, pudiendo jugar un “farol”.

boardgame.name: Gaudeamus!: Zbuduj średniowieczny uniwersytet
boardgame.description:
Travel back in time to medieval Cracow and become one of the historical personages: Queen Jadwiga of Anjou, King Władysław Jagiełło, King Casimir the Great, or Cardinal Zbigniew Oleśnicki. Build the first Polish university and make it famous all over Europe!

The action of the game takes place at the turn of the 15th and 16th centuries, in the heyday of the University of Krakow. The goal of the game is to found a university with 4 faculties: liberal arts, medicine, law, and theology. The first player to create all of them wins. To build a faculty, a player must collect the required cards and pay its cost.

In each game round, players take their turns consecutively. During single turn, the player first draws and resolves the effect of a Random Event card, and then performs one of the available actions:
a) opening a faculty (if the player meets the requirements),
b) exchange of up to 3 cards from hand,
c) using a special card and resolving its effect,
d) buying a card from the board.
At the end of the round, players bid for new action cards and collect coins from the faculties that are already running.

boardgame.name: Who Killed Robert Prentice
boardgame.description:
Through the use of clues the reader and Lieutenant John Milton Schwab of the Florida Police attempt to solve the mystery surrounding the death by poisoning of a wealthy British businessman.

Crime Dossier 2 of a 4 book set that was an early progenitor of the modern mystery suspect / cold case tabletop games.

boardgame.name: Ice Barrier
boardgame.description:
You are a small troop of 20 people who reached a sheltered valley a good 12,000 years ago. As winter approaches, you disagree on how to proceed: some of you want to risk it and move south across the ice barrier, another prefers to stay and wait, and the third thinks it best to go straight back to the old home. One evening you will come together to make a decision.

You lead one of the three groups and want to enforce your opinion with your 6 people. To do this, you take turns placing character cards between you and one of the other two groups so that one half of the card faces towards you and the other half faces the rival group. One half of the card has a numerical value that shows how convincing the person is in the discussion. With the other half, you use the person's special ability. So you always have to decide which side you want to benefit from and which side you might concede to another camp.

With these special abilities you can swap cards, turn them, or even knock other tribe members unconscious. This also allows you to influence the row of cards between the other two, because otherwise you can only place cards to the left or right of you, but not opposite.

When all the cards are played, see which of you won this primitive debate. To do this, you add up the numbers that are facing you to the left and right. Your rivals claim the other halves of the cards for themselves. The one who could collect the most points after three rounds has prevailed over the others and decides the further fate of the troop.

Additionally needed: 2 chips to mark the people protected by the warrior.

boardgame.name: Gartenparty
boardgame.description:
You're having a summer party in the garden. A few friends arrive early in the afternoon to help with the preparations: Beer tables are dragged, tablecloths laid out and space made for the drinks. In one corner of the garden, however, a loud competition breaks out over who will hang the most beautiful string of lights. Who will hang the coolest fairy lights at your garden party?

All cards show three power lines with light bulbs and lanterns of different colors hanging from them. You place one of them in front of you as your own starting card. The rest of the cards are placed in the center of the table. Look at them carefully, because it's all about speed! Once you've all placed one hand flat on the table, you're ready to go.

You grab cards with only one hand at a time, as fast as you can, and place them on your string of lights. Also make sure that the power lines are not always straight. This can get lost in the heat of the moment. You can also flip cards, because maybe the back side will be more useful. But you have to put your hand flat on the table again before you can return to the action.

Whoever has laid the required length first, depending on the number of players, gives the signal to the others to come to the end. Now you can see who has really conjured up the best string of lights:

The more light bulbs and lanterns of the same color follow each other in a line, the more points the chain of lights earns you. The lanterns are particularly valuable because, unlike light bulbs, they also count individually and even double the point value if they are part of a row. When your arms are unknotted and your eyes are no longer spinning, you can immediately start the next round.

It's game 17 of the series "Die Kleinen Feinen".

boardgame.name: Die Bremer
boardgame.description:
Fairy tales are just fairy tales after all! In reality, Donkey, Dog, Cat and Rooster are the first professional gang of gangsters and are up to mischief in the otherwise quiet Bremen. Luckily, the police stand in their way!

You get three cards in your hand, only whoever plays the first card gets four cards. Then you try to form rows of cards from 0 to 4. To do this, you always place the next highest or next lowest card.

If you have a card in the same color, you may skip values. Since you are not allowed to fill up this gap, rows can remain incomplete.

If you cannot or do not want to play a card, you must pass and take a card from the draw pile into your hand. You may play this card directly. When a row is finished - whether complete or not - or everyone in the round has passed, the round is over. Whoever placed the last card of the row gets the lowest card in his hand and starts the next round. All other cards in the row are discarded.

Once the draw pile is empty, you may only pass if you really can't play. Whichever of you has no card left in his or her hand when he or she would have to play a card, wins the round. The losers then receive one minus point for each card in their hand, two for a policeman. Whoever has collected the fewest minus points at the end of a certain number of rounds wins the game.

boardgame.name: Egil
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The core rulebook for the lite indie game EGIL.

boardgame.name: No Time For Prayer: The Battles of Head of Passes and Forts Jackson and St. Philip
boardgame.description:
Come Mr. Osbon, this is not the time for prayer!
--Admiral Farragut, to flag officer Osbon, who was kneeling on the USS Hartford’s main deck preparing a shell fuse during the battle of Forts Jackson and Philip.

No Time For Prayer details the battles for the port and city of New Orleans; Head of Passes and Forts Jackson and St. Philip.

The battles to take control of New Orleans were not easy ones. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

Players will also need one standard deck of playing cards, a six-sided die and one ten sided die to play the game. A die roll of 0 is read as 10 and not zero.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of No Time For Prayer by the designer and publisher.
Mounted counters can be had for an additional $8.00. A custom card set, that replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the rules, can also be had for an additional $10.00.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: Kommissar Rex und seine Freunde!
boardgame.description:
A Quizgame featuring the famous TV-Dog REX, regarding everything from the TV series and dogs in general.

The areas of knowledge are series, lineage, training, husbandry, behavior and breeding.

boardgame.name: Lobster Roll
boardgame.description:
The Penobscot Bay off the coast of Maine produces a yearly bounty of saltwater fish, shellfish, and lobsters. This solitaire roll-and-write game lets players become commercial fishers, seeking the largest and best catches of these valuable seafoods. It’s a risky endeavor, requiring proper timing, thoughtful management of your resources, and a bit of old-fashioned good luck.

Choose your location, roll your dice, and see what you've caught. If you succeed, sell your catch strategically to earn top dollar. If you don't succeed, use your failures wisely, to improve your operation for next season.

This is a solitaire, print-and-play, roll-and-write design. The game comes with rulebook, map sheet, and record sheet. The only other bits required are three dice: one each in green, red, and blue.

The game takes about 45 minutes (15 minutes for each of three rounds), and is appropriate for ages 10 and up.

boardgame.name: Bad News On the Doorstep: The Battle of Kontum, May 1972
boardgame.description:
“The poor display of any will to fight by the [ARVN] 22nd Division at Tan Canh is discouraging and makes the defense of Kontum City difficult to foretell… In light of this there is little basis for confidence that Hue or Kontum will be held.” –General Creighton Abrams to Secretary of Defense Melvin Laird.

Following the 1971 defeat of the ARVN (Army of the Republic of South Vietnam) in their Operation Lam Son 719 offensive in Laos it was very apparent the US policy of “Vietnamization” was in serious trouble, The North Vietnamese High Command walked away from the Paris Peace Talks during the fighting and advanced their plans for an all-out offensive against South Vietnam.

In April 1972 the North Vietnamese and their Communist allies in the South, the National Liberation Front (NLF), launched a broad offensive, code named Nguyen Hue (name of the Vietnamese leader who defeated Chinese invaders in 1789) against the ARVN in South Vietnam from their strongholds in the Central Highlands as well as from Laos and across the DMZ (de-militarized zone) that bordered North and South Vietnam. Dubbed the “Easter Offensive” by the US press, the Communist attack was the largest since those during Tet in 1968, and like that earlier offensive, the Communists hoped that the offensive would initiate insurrections throughout South Vietnam and the collapse of its government. One of the most violent battles of the Easter Offensive was fought over the town of Kontum. The central highlands town had been subject to many attacks over the years, but this was the most prolonged and unlike the earlier fights which were waged by the NLF, this was a large-scale conventional battle that included tanks and massive numbers of artillery and rocket support. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts?

Each copy of Bad News on the Doorstep is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets
104 un-mounted, double-sided units
10 pages of rules

Players will need a standard deck of cards with all Ace, 2 and 3 cards removed, one six sided (D6) and one ten sided (D10) set of dice to play the game. Treat a DR of 0 on the D10 as ten, not zero.

boardgame.name: Chess more than a game!
boardgame.description:
4 levels - 8 categories - 32 important places of chess - 512 questions: Test your knowledge concerning the history, the rules, the board and its pieces and much more around on the most popular board games in the world!

The game board shows a map of Europe with 32 places that are significant to the history of chess. Each place is displayed with a playing field containing one of eight category symbols. The starting point is Madrid, the location of the first European chess tournament in 1575. The goal is to get to Tromsö, the venue of the 2014 Chess Olympiade.

The cards are divided into eight categories: Peculiarities – Openings – Mate in 1 – Rules – Game Board & Figures – Chess Lexicon – Timeless Beauty – Quiz. Every category is positioned on the board game with its own symbol and colour. On each question card, you will find questions for four different difficulty levels: Pawn –> Knight –> Rook –> Queen. The questions are ordered from easiest to most difficult, so there is an opportunity for everyone to be involved.

boardgame.name: Dice Mancala
ダイスマンカラ (Dice_Mancala)
boardgame.description:
ダイスマンカラ (Dice_Mancala) is a dice game from Japan. The players are dice farmers, and work hard in the dice fields harvesting dice.

Using a Kalah mechanism, players collect dice which they then use to roll and complete treasure cards. When a player has got their fourth treasure card, the game ends once everyone has had their turn. The player with the most points from their treasure and from the dice they harvested is the winner.

Whilst the active player rolls dice, and the other players also get to roll dice. The more dice the active player rolls, the better their chance to gain treasure, but the more chances the other players get too.

The designer says the game needs more than luck to win. Players make strategic choices through the game.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – T'au
boardgame.description:
The T’au are a young and dynamic race of technologically advanced aliens whose empire is spreading like wildfire across the stars. Ruled and guided by the enigmatic Ethereals, the T’au seek to unite every sentient being under the light of the T’au’va, or Greater Good. They prefer that others join this growing alliance willingly, but do not hesitate to use force to fulfil their destiny wherever they must. At the forefront of this fight are the Hunter Cadres of the Fire Caste. Comprising highly mobile and well-armed soldiery, led and supported by veteran warriors piloting deadly battlesuits, gunships and strike fighters, these armies sweep all before them in a blizzard of devastating firepower. Signature battle strategies such as the decisive Mont’ka or the cunning ambush of the Kauyon see the enemy outmanoeuvred at every turn, while their potent blend of technological might and ideological fanaticism ensure the T’au achieve victory after victory.

This 136-page book comprehensively covers the T'au Empire. It has everything you need to bring the technological might of the T'au to bear on the tabletop in order to expand the empire, plus a selection of lore and art to inspire your own collection.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.
